DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the facial measurements for determining the proper sizes of oropharyngeal airway. Investigators hypothesized that the length between incisors and mandible angle is more appropriate to estimate the size of oropharyngeal airway compared with the length between mouth corner and mandible angle.
DOC.brief_title: Assessment of Facial Measurements, the Length of Mouth Corner-mandible Angle and Incisors-mandible Angle, for Determining the Proper Sizes of Oropharyngeal Airway
DOC.criteria: adult patients undergoing surgery that requires general anesthesia anticipated difficult intubation patients without teeth or with loose teeth cervical spine disease upper airway disease body mass index over 35 kg/m2 pregnancy
